comments:
Create a data source using classic models.
Create a SQL query data set.
Edit data set.
Select Property binding.
Define query text 'select CUSTOMERS.CUSTOMERNUMBER from CUSTOMERS'
For the query on the Query tab, I use:
select EMPLOYEES.EMPLOYEENUMBER 
from EMPLOYEES
I put the created data set in a simple listing report and try to preview the report (not in the Edit Data Set, as this works fine and displays the Employee number without problem).
The query defined for the data set doesn?t run correctly until I remove the query text.
Errors in preview:
There are errors on the report page: 

-There are error(s) in Data : 29 

Error0 : data.engine.InvalidFieldName ( 122 time(s) )

detail : org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.core.DataException: Invalid field name: EMPLOYEENUMBER at org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.executor.ResultObject.getFieldValue(ResultObject.java:138) at org.eclipse.birt.data.engine.impl.ResultIterator.evaluateCompiledExpression(ResultIterator.java:237) at

It's not a bug. 
From the different query text in property binding&query text, we got the different resultset.One is  CUSTOMERS.CUSTOMERNUMBER, and another is  EMPLOYEES.EMPLOYEENUMBER. These are totally different result set. If you defined the property binding, you should realize that in report layout, the result displayed is genertated by property binding. But you use the row["EMPLOYEENUMBER"] in the report preview not row["CUSTOMERNUMBER"], so this is an InvalidFieldName. You should change it into row["CUSTOMERNUMBER"], or modify the property binding like this:'select CUSTOMERS.CUSTOMERNUMBER as EMPLOYEENUMBER from CUSTOMERS'. BTW, the property binding is supplied to advanced user,commonly the resulset object should not be changed at will,or the agility given by property binidng is too hard to deal with.
